MS MCQs

    Datacenter components - Infrastructure and facilities

    »

    1. Which of the following is not a typical feature in a datacenter server room?

      Raised floor

      Computer room air conditioner (CRAC)

      Power distribution units (PDUs)

      Display walls


    2. What are the primary design goals in planning, configuring, and implementing power distribution for datacenters?

      Carbon footprint and environment friendliness

      Manageability and utilization

      Reduced capital expenses

      Efficiency and reliability


    3. Which entity is responsible for selecting the power feed that goes into a datacenter?

      UPS line conditioner

      Generator bypass switch

      Power distribution unit

      Automatic or universal transfer switch


    4. Why is cooling so important in datacenters?

      To prevent data loss from magnetic drives

      IT equipment generates heat and must be cooled to maintain optimum performance and obtain maximum life

      To prevent fire hazards


    5. Which of the following is not a datacenter cooling technique?

      Evaporative cooling

      Use of CRACs

      Dry ice chiller

      Top-of-rack cooling

      In-row cooling
